unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use in both French and English.
Develop elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the French language.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of French at beginners level.
Identify, describe and evaluate a few aspects of French-speaking cultures and societies.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and French practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their following seminar and feel comfortable with each week's content before starting a new week.

enrolment_rules.description: Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC French

assessments.description: Homework Exercises on French Grammar and Vocabulary

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit provides French conversation classes for leisure or business travellers. Students will learn practical spoken French that can be applied to real-life situations in international French speaking environments. Lessons cover everyday conversational experiences, teaching all kinds of travellers how to take and access public transport in Paris and metropolitan France, how to order and buy food in restaurants and supermarkets, how to book and arrange for suitable accommodation and how to organise activities and excursions on their travels. The unit is suitable for beginners in spoken French, no prior knowledge of French is required.
data.title: French for Travellers
